content.description: be ready to work right off the ground! You will traverse right at  5th bolt  for 12d and continue back up left to high anchor. direct finish  13c or d.
content.location: start 10' left of borderline,

content.description:
A fun trad lead. 

  Start at the bottom of the crack and angle up and left to the top. 

  We found this crack full of moss, dirt and lichen (in an unclimbable state).  We cleaned it all up and then climbed it (summer 2012), so now it is ready to go. 

  We don't know if anyone had already climbed the crack back in the distant past. If anyone has information, please post.
content.protection: Looking at the route from the ground you can see what size pro you need.
content.location: This route is on the face a few meters R of Quiet Room.  It is the obvious slanting crack that goes up and left.

content.description: a fun route -
content.location: climbs the black & white striped wall 10 feet left of birds eye

content.description: climbs much easier than it appears from the bottom,,,
content.protection: normal rack, one 4" cam makes it real nice!
content.location: located on the far right(15' right of cracked up)climb a right slanting wide crack/chimney to a ledge with 2 bolt anchor,,you can tr the right arete of the chimney from these anchors!

content.description: climb up to a ledge under the 4' roof. palm and limbo ur way out to reach holds at the lip(harder if ur short)then hold on tight when your feet cut!
content.location: in the center of the outback there is a large roof, climb out break/ flare in center.

content.description: Route between -glory hole and fb-(birds eye)Climb up slab to a big ledge. Lay back up the in cut flakes to a nasty crimp. step up on tiny foot holds to a nice ledge for your hands. Use yellow colored block for a hand hold and smear your feet while you reach up to the slightly down ward slanting flake. Good holds after crux to the top.
great little step bouldery route, this thing will give u a great flash pump.
content.location: this route climbs the short wall at the right of the access gully on the left end of th e cliff 40 feet left of birds eye.

content.description: fun route with a crux at the anchors!    climb up right on to the flake then clip anchors.
content.location: this route starts the same as sunspot on the FB wall then heads left at first bolt!

climbs.name: Quiet Room
climbs.fa: tr -dorcas miller --bolted and lead by Michael Reeves

content.description: super fun with some techy moves getting to the 2cd bolt.
content.protection: 3bolts to anchors,and u can sling a small tree at top if needed.
content.location: this route is 20' right of Cracked up, climb the arete right of straight jacket

climbs.name: O-C-D
climbs.fa: Hazel Groce (directvar) ben townsend- original line-

content.description: layback up and on to a big flake. then face climb straight up past a low bolt left of a big flake- straight up a wondering face past two bolts to a small ramp on right( original trad line) then two more bolts of crux climbing to high anchor in the roof.   originally a trad line to the right - but the direct start was much cleaner and better climbing-
content.location: this route starts five feet left of voluntary madness-   and just right of funny farm.

content.description: This is a direct start to the "Four Gray Bolts" route. A couple of meters to the right of the gray bolts, climb up a line of 3 shiny bolts to gain the bottom of the narrow arete. You can finish by climbing the arete of the "Four Gray Bolts" route.
content.location: Just to the right of the "Four Gray Bolts" route.

content.description: The route uses the same line of bolts as Quiet Room. Climb up the face to the right of the bolts, reaching left to clip them.
content.location: Just to the right of Quiet Room.

content.description: crux is pulling out onto face off ledge above slacker.
content.protection: set of tcu's and nuts. (fixed wire @ crux)   1 bolt.
content.location: just right of slacker climb up a crack to gully and a ledge on top of slacker, from here move out and right on sloping holds until u can climb up arete.

content.description: Super fun route, look for the glory hole hidden deep in back of horizontal above the 5th bolt to make the next move just a little easier!
content.protection: 6 bolts     blue tcu with alpine draw.   to lower offs
content.location: route starts 5' right of FB,   climb slab until a horizontal ledge step right in to shallow dihedrals (blue tcu) steep back left @ 4th bolt.

content.description: Start with bouldery moves up the corner -- committing, unless you stem up the convenient oak tree first and arrange solid gear above. Continue up a slab to a headwall, a short right-facing corner, and the right wall of the prow. Reachy in spots.
content.protection: Four bolts, light rack to 2", fixed anchor; lower off.
content.location: About 15' right of Glory Hole and 30' left of Squiddler on the Roof, at a short overhanging left-facing corner. The finish is the right face of a prominent jutting prow above.

climbs.name: funny farm
climbs.fa: weaver/ bolted and lead by Ben Townsend

content.description: fun little easy slab route.
content.protection: 3 bolts and finger sized cam. 2 bolt Anchor.NOTE- see comment…seems cam is no longer necessary
content.location: 20' left of cracked up

content.description: climb an often wet start to ledges(10+ ish), then angle up right to base of a short dihedral couple ok holds and crappy stems leave u staring at big jug up left(crux), so Dyno-u -mite!5-8 climbing leads u to the anchors!
content.location: located just right of Squidler on the roof in the center of the cliff,

content.description: climb the left facing cornor past a crux about midway!
content.location: right of cracked up

content.description: This is an alternative finish to the "Four Gray Bolts" route. Clip the third gray bolt with a longish sling and then go leftward to ascend the obvious corner. Clip the (shiny) bolt in the corner and continue up and around the roof that contains a fist crack. Finish at the Three Stooges anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of Three Stooges.

content.description: follow a thin seam 4' right of the arete until second bolt, then step left  and follow the arete up.
content.location: far right route on the right side of cliff band

climbs.name: The Corner Store
climbs.fa: Sandor Nagy and Russ Johnson, October 2020

content.description: Follow the thin crack that starts behind the ash tree, but don't use the tree for "aid" in the first few moves. The crack continues up the corner through a couple of bulges. From the juniper bush, continue up the face (with a crack for pro) on the right side. Ascend a slab to an oak and pine tree. Finish up a short finger/hand crack in a dihedral, which goes to the top of the cliff. To descend, go right into a gully, and then follow the gully down to the bottom of the cliff.
content.protection: The route can be protected well with wired stoppers and cams.
content.location: The route starts at the base of a large ash tree, a few meters left of The Three Stooges.

content.description: climb the left side of double overhanging side of the arete, super technical
content.protection: bolts, stick clip the second bolt
content.location: large arete on right side of cliff

content.description: fun climbing up to a crux at 2/3 height. can seem a little harder the first time u try it!
content.protection: 7bolts& a pin + a cam in the 3/8" range for top to LO(lower off's)
content.location: climbs the center of the brown wall on left side of the cliff.

content.description: start 30 feet left of cracked up in a small left facing cornor
Moderate climbing past three grey bolts leads to a difficult crux arete (right of the fourth bolt) fo the finish.
content.location: This is a line of four grey bolts a couple of meters to the right of Three Stooges. I finishes on the steep this arete to the right of the final bolt.

content.description: great short crag, nice place to climb in late afternoon, and most likily never see another person.
